item.title: Asian Shares Dip, RBI Cuts Monetary Policy Stance: Markets Wrap
item.description: Asian equities traded in a narrow range as talks between President Donald Trump and Xi Jinping failed to boost sentiment and investors stayed on the sidelines ahead of the US jobs data.
item.dc:creator: Anand Krishnamoorthy

item.title: Starmer's Stock-Market Apathy Is Bad for Growth
item.description: It’s been another bad week for London’s status as a listing venue. A shame, then, that recent government policy has focused on private markets investing.
item.dc:creator: Chris Hughes

media:content.media:description: LEIGH ON SEA, ENGLAND - NOVEMBER 4: A closed sign hangs on the door window against a British Union Jack flag on a cafe in Old Leigh on November 4, 2024 in Leigh-on-Sea, United Kingdom. (Photo by John Keeble/Getty Images)

item.title: Burning Trees for Electricity Isn't Sustainable
item.description: Continued support for Drax Group will only make sense if the UK government can detail a better vision — and execute it.
item.dc:creator: Lara Williams

item.title: Portugal Considers Sweetening Incentives for Golden Visa Program
item.description: Less than two months after Spain scrapped its golden visa due to concerns about its effect on the housing market, Portugal is considering whether to sweeten its golden visa program and make a special tax regime for expatriates even more attractive.
item.dc:creator: Henrique Almeida, Joao Lima

media:content.media:description: Portugal’s golden visa only requires participants to spend about a week per year in the country.

item.title: Winners of Defense Stock Frenzy in Europe, From Chemical to Goggle Makers
item.description: This year’s surge in Europe’s biggest defense stocks has elicited some obvious winners, leading investors to dig deeper beneath the surface for other names that might stand to benefit from the billions being diverted toward military budgets.
item.dc:creator: Isolde MacDonogh

item.title: H&M Billionaire Quietly Moves Retailer Toward Private Ownership
item.description: Hennes & Mauritz AB, the fast-fashion retailer that’s been listed on the Swedish stock market since 1974, is steadily moving back toward private ownership.
item.dc:creator: Rafaela Lindeberg

media:content.media:description: Shoppers pass a Hennes & Mauritz AB store in Athens. Photographer: Yorgos Karahalis/Bloomberg

item.title: Morgan Stanley Opens xAI Books With Musk in Trump Crosshairs
item.description: Even before Elon Musk and President Donald Trump’s public falling out, selling debt for the tech mogul’s companies has always been tricky for Morgan Stanley. But xAI Corp. was supposed to be different.
item.dc:creator: Carmen Arroyo, Jill R Shah

media:content.media:description: The xAI logo on a laptop computer arranged in New York, US, on Thursday, Dec. 7, 2023. Elon Musk's artificial intelligence company xAI is seeking to raise $1 billion in funding from equity investors, according to a new filing. Photographer: Gabby Jones/Bloomberg

item.title: Gold’s Cheaper Precious Metals Peers Surge to Multi-Year Highs
item.description: Silver extended gains to trade just below a 13-year high while platinum hit highest level in more than two years, signaling growing investor appetite for precious metals used by the industrial sector.
item.dc:creator: Sybilla Gross

item.title: Swiggy Shares Set for Best Week of 2025 on Bullish Analyst Calls
item.description: Swiggy Ltd. is headed for its biggest weekly gain of the year, buoyed by a brighter outlook for the Indian company’s main food delivery business and moves to curb quick commerce losses.
item.dc:creator: Diksha Rajput

media:content.media:description: An employee at a Swiggy facility in Mumbai.

item.title: Russia on Cusp of First Rate Cut Since 2022 as Inflation Eases
item.description: Russia’s central bank is on the cusp of the first interest-rate cut in three years, as easing inflation opens the door to relief for an economy struggling under the weight of high borrowing costs.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Halpin

media:content.media:description: The Russian Central Bank headquarters in Moscow.

item.title: PBOC Eases Liquidity Jitters With Surprise Cash Disclosure
item.description: China’s central bank added 1 trillion yuan ($139 billion) of three-month funds into markets on Friday, following a surprise mid-month disclosure for the operation likely aimed at preempting a seasonal cash crunch.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Zhu, Wenjin Lv

item.title: India's Bond Rally May Deepen as Rate Cuts Loom
item.description: Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:
item.dc:creator: Ashutosh Joshi

item.title: BYD’s Misfire With Price Cuts Sparks $20 Billion Stock Selloff
item.description: A renewed EV price war launched by BYD Co. has shaved more than $20 billion off its market value in just two weeks, as skepticism over the top Chinese automaker’s strategy takes some steam out of its big rally.
item.dc:creator: Charlotte Yang

item.title: Pressure Mounts for Japan to Adjust Bond Sales as Soon as July
item.description: Expectations in the market are intensifying that the Japanese government may adjust debt issuance as soon as next month by increasing sales of shorter maturity securities and trimming offerings of longer-dated ones.
item.dc:creator: Mia Glass, Masahiro Hidaka

item.title: Morgan Stanley Sees More Inflows Into Chinese Equities
item.description: Morgan Stanley's Laura Wang discusses her outlook for Chinese equities on Bloomberg Television. Wang says a weaker US dollar is "positive" for China's stock markets and adds that the firm expects more inflows in the next six to 12 months. (Source: Bloomberg)

media:content.media:description: Morgan Stanley Photographer: Victor J. Blue/Bloomberg

item.title: Oil Holds Gains After Trump-Xi Call Signals Easing Trade Tension
item.description: Oil was steady after advancing Thursday on optimism around easing trade tensions between the US and China following a call between the leaders of the two countries.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Chen

media:content.media:description: A pump jack in Midland, Texas. Photographer: Anthony Prieto/Bloomberg

item.title: Omada Health IPO Raises $150 Million Priced in Middle of Range
item.description: Omada Health Inc.’s initial public offering raised $150 million, with shares of the digital health-care company pricing in the middle of the marketed range.
item.dc:creator: Angel Adegbesan

item.title: Bond Traders Look to US Jobs Report for Signals of Fed Rate Path
item.description: Bond traders will dissect the May jobs report for any signs of a softening labor market as they gauge the timing of Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts.
item.dc:creator: Ye Xie

item.title: Trump, Xi Agree to More Trade Talks as Rare Earths Dispute Cools
item.description: US President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping on Thursday agreed to further trade talks aimed at resolving disputes over tariffs and supplies of rare earth minerals at the heart of tensions between the world’s two largest economies. Bloomberg TV's Stephen Engle speaks on The Asia Trade about what we know so far. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Anduril Deploys Tech Along Southern Border
item.description: Anduril Industries Inc. Executive Chairman Trae Stephens says its technology is being used across the southern border. "We are deployed across somewhere between 1/3 and 1/2 of the entire southwest border at this point." Stephens speaks to Tom Giles at the Bloomberg Tech summit. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Bloomberg Tech 2025 Opening Video
item.description: Led by Bloomberg’s Emily Chang & Tom Giles, Bloomberg Tech 2025 in San Francisco brings together leaders across tech and business to discuss how executives, entrepreneurs and investors can navigate the hazards and multiply opportunities in today’s AI landscape. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: WndrCo's Katzenberg, Wang on Investing in the Next Big Thing
item.description: WndrCo Founding Partner Jeffrey Katzenberg and General Partner ChenLi Wang discuss their venture capital fund and how they’re identifying and scaling startups at the intersection of technology, media, and AI. They spoke with Bloomberg Television’s Caroline Hyde at Bloomberg Tech in San Francisco. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Anduril Co-Founder Stephens on Innovating in Defense
item.description: Trae Stephens, Co-Founder and Executive Chairman of Anduril Industries, discusses national security innovation, AI defense systems, and the future of military tech. Stephens spoke with Bloomberg’s Tom Giles at Bloomberg Tech in San Francisco. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Debt Could Lead to Dangerous Decline, Summers Says
item.description: Former Treasury Secretary Lawrence Summers says President Donald Trump's tax and spending plan will add to the US debt load, undermining the nation's status as the preeminent global power. “It’s a prescription for deadly, dangerous decline,” said Summers, a Harvard University professor and paid contributor to Bloomberg TV. He speaks on Bloomberg Television’s Wall Street Week with David Westin. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Wall Street Reacts to Trump-Musk Spat and What’s Next for Tesla Shares
item.description: For months, Tesla shareholders were tormented by Elon Musk’s role in the administration of President Donald Trump. But any relief brought by his formal government exit last week quickly turned to fear as the electric-vehicle maker’s chief executive traded barbs with his former boss.
item.dc:creator: Jeran Wittenstein, Ryan Vlastelica

media:content.media:description: A Tesla Inc. logo at a dealership in Valencia, Spain.

item.title: Extreme Weather Is Stress-Testing India’s Infrastructure Drive
item.description: Indian monsoons this year — the earliest onset since 2009 — damaged new public infrastructure across the country, putting pressure on Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s push for an infrastructure upgrade in the world’s fifth-largest economy.
item.dc:creator: Apoorva Ajith

media:content.media:description: Acharya Atre Chowk underground metro station inundated during heavy rainfall, in Mumbai on May 26. Source: PTI/AP Photo

item.title: Figure AI CEO on Building General Purpose Robots
item.description: Brett Adcock, Founder and CEO, Figure AI speaks with Bloomberg Television's Ed Ludlow about how it is training humanoid robots for logistics, manufacturing, and future roles in the home at Bloomberg Tech in San Francisco. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Meituan to Expand Drone Delivery Routes Over Dubai Marina
item.description: Keeta, the overseas brand of Chinese food delivery giant Meituan, is expanding its drone delivery service in Dubai as part of an ambitious overseas push. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Stocks Fall as Trump-Musk Fight Sinks Tesla by 14% | The Close 6/05/2025
item.description: Bloomberg Television brings you the latest news and analysis leading up to the final minutes and seconds before and after the closing bell on Wall Street. Today's guests are Kristina Hooper, Man Group, Max Chafkin, Bloomberg News, Sharon Zackfia, William Blair, Jeremy Allaire, Circle Co-Founder, CEO, Ed Ludlow, Bloomberg News, Kenneth Shea, Bloomberg Intelligence, Jay Woods, Freedom Capital Markets, Jess Menton, Bloomberg News, Ross Gerber, Gerber Kawasaki, Ted Mortonson, Baird, Stephen Yalof, Tanger CEO, Aneesh Raman, LinkedIn, Gregory Morris, NYC Employment & Training Coalition, Rod Johnson, BLK & Bolder Co-Founder. (Source: Bloomberg)

media:content.media:description: Tesla Motors Inc Photographer: Tomohiro Ohsumi/Bloomberg

item.title: Otter.ai CEO on Developing AI Avatars to Handle Meetings
item.description: Otter.ai CEO Sam Liang discusses the developement of an AI avatar to handle 'routine' meetings. He speaks with Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on the sidelines of the Bloomberg Tech Conference. (Source: Bloomberg)
